title: The Laptop you'll actually buy - Dell Inspiron 15 7000
description: What do you actually want in a laptop when you really dig down to it. Do you want something that'll be your ultimate gaming machine or something that you can reasonably rely on every time you boot it up?   Buy Dell Inspiron 7000 On Amazon (Paid Link):  On Walmart (Paid Link):  On NewEgg (Paid Link):   Buy Dell XPS 15 On Amazon (Paid Link):  On Walmart (Paid Link):  On NewEgg (Paid Link):   iFixit Pro Kit:   Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.  GET MERCH:   Twitter:  Instagram:  Facebook:
transcript: - So the other day I'm watching a video for the Audi RS6 Avant and thinking, "That's a really nice car that I'm never going to buy," because it's literally five times more expensive than a Golf GTI, and you get, what? It's definitely faster, it's better. But realistically, day-to-day, how different is it going to be? Which brings us to the Inspiron 15 7000, you know? It's definitely no RS6 Avant. The Inspiron 15 7000. This one right here has, I'd say, respectable ports but nothing amazing. So we have an SD card reader. Turn that around so you guys can see it. So we have an SD card reader, USB Type A, combo headphone/microphone port. Around the other side we have full-size HDMI, two USB Type As and... Ooh, a Thunderbolt port! You normally don't expect to see that on something that's at this price. This is just over $1,000. So have that context when we go into this. Does it feel like an XPS 15? The actual screen isn't the stiffest. I'm pretty sure that's all that's, yeah. The screen isn't super-duper stiff, but also, who is doing this all day long? I'm not, and I don't believe it's touch, yeah. It's not a touch screen, so you don't really have to worry about that too, too much. There's rubber right here, but it has such a small amount of lift that I can't really imagine that it's doing anything for the thermals or the keyboard position or anything. So we're looking at a Core i7-9750H, which is a six-core processor and pretty damn fast, I would have to say. It's not gonna, you know... You'd normally expect to see like 256 and maybe a hard drive, something like that. We've got Intel Wireless, which probably means it's pretty good. I believe it's 2x2.
